ST.en: The article points out that from the distribution of non-green color patches in the graph, it can be seen that the oriental countries in the traditional sense are more conservative towards Bitcoin than the West.
ST.zh: 文章指出，从图中非绿色的色块分布可以看出，传统意义上的东方国家对比特币的态度比西方更为保守。

TT1.text: The article points out that, as can be seen from the distribution of the non-green color blocks in the chart, traditional Eastern countries have a more conservative attitude towards Bitcoin compared to the West.

TT2.text: The article points out that, judging from the distribution of non-green-colored blocks in the chart, traditionally defined Eastern countries have a more conservative attitude towards Bitcoin compared to Western countries.

TT3.text: The article points out that the distribution of non-green color blocks in the chart shows that the attitude towards Bitcoin in traditionally Eastern countries is more conservative compared to the West.

ST.en: Russia is currently the largest country that defines Bitcoin as illegal. China is one of the largest restricted markets for Bitcoin. India is one of the largest countries that have not commented on Bitcoin and have not made relevant policies.
ST.zh: 俄罗斯是目前定义比特币为非法的最大国家，中国是比特币最大的受限市场之一，印度是对比特币尚不予置评、还没有出台相关政策的最大国家之一。

TT1.text: Russia is currently the largest country to define Bitcoin as illegal, China is one of the largest restricted markets for Bitcoin, and India is one of the largest countries that has yet to comment on Bitcoin or introduce relevant policies.

TT2.text: Russia is currently the largest country to define Bitcoin as illegal, China is one of the largest restricted markets for Bitcoin, and India is one of the largest countries that has not yet commented on Bitcoin or issued any related policies.

TT3.text: Russia is currently the largest country to define Bitcoin as illegal, China is one of the largest restricted markets for Bitcoin, and India is one of the largest countries that has not yet commented on Bitcoin or issued related policies.

ST.en: North America and Western Europe are the regions that have highest level of tolerance to Bitcoin i.e. where green patches are concentrated.
ST.zh: 北美和西欧是对比特币接受程度最高的地区，即绿色块的分布更为集中。

TT1.text: North America and Western Europe are the regions with the highest acceptance of Bitcoin, indicated by the more concentrated distribution of the green blocks.

TT2.text: North America and Western Europe are the regions with the highest acceptance of Bitcoin, where the distribution of green blocks is more concentrated.

TT3.text: North America and Western Europe are the regions with the highest acceptance of Bitcoin, where the distribution of green blocks is more concentrated.

ST.en: The views of the countries in the Middle East and Latin America on Bitcoin are clearly divided, so, the distribution of color patches in these areas is more mixed.
ST.zh: 中东和拉丁美洲各国对比特币的看法呈现明显分化，上述地区的色块分布更为混杂。

TT1.text: The opinions on Bitcoin in Middle Eastern and Latin American countries show obvious divergence, and the distribution of opinions in these regions is more mixed.

TT2.text: The views on Bitcoin in various countries in the Middle East and Latin America are distinctly polarized, and the distribution of color blocks in these regions is more mixed.

TT3.text: The views on Bitcoin in Middle Eastern and Latin American countries show a clear division, with the distribution of colored blocks in these regions being more mixed.

ST.en: Among them, Iraq, Iran, Turkey and Brazil are all legitimate Bitcoin markets. Afghanistan, Pakistan, Saudi Arabia, Egypt, and Bolivia have some restrictions on the trading and use of Bitcoin. Most Latin American countries have not made any comments about Bitcoin.
ST.zh: 其中伊拉克、伊朗、土耳其、巴西都是合法的比特币市场，阿富汗、巴基斯坦、沙特、埃及、玻利维亚等对其交易和使用有一定程度的限制，更多的拉美国家对比特币还没有发声。

TT1.text: Among them, Iraq, Iran, Turkey, and Brazil all have legal Bitcoin markets, while Afghanistan, Pakistan, Saudi Arabia, Egypt, Bolivia, and others have certain restrictions on its trading and usage. Moreover, more Latin American countries have yet to speak out on Bitcoin.

TT2.text: Among them, Iraq, Iran, Turkey, and Brazil are legal markets for Bitcoin, while Afghanistan, Pakistan, Saudi Arabia, Egypt, and Bolivia have certain restrictions on its trading and use. More Latin American countries have yet to speak out about Bitcoin.

TT3.text: Among them, Iraq, Iran, Turkey, and Brazil are all legal Bitcoin markets, while Afghanistan, Pakistan, Saudi Arabia, Egypt, and Bolivia impose certain restrictions on its trading and usage. More Latin American countries have yet to express their stance on Bitcoin.

ST.en: From the above data, it can be seen that of the 246 countries that have been rated, a total of 99 countries (or 40% of the total) haven't imposed any restrictions on the transactions and use of Bitcoin. They are represented by green and orange patches.
ST.zh: 综合上述数据可知，在全球受统计的246个国家中，共有99个国家（或占比40%）对比特币的交易和使用不施加限制，即绿色和橘黄色的地区。

TT1.text: Based on the above data, it can be concluded that among the 246 countries globally that are statistically accounted for, a total of 99 countries (or 40%) do not impose restrictions on the trading and use of Bitcoin, which are represented by the green and orange-yellow regions.

TT2.text: Based on the above data, it is known that among the 246 countries globally that are statistically accounted for, a total of 99 countries (or 40%) impose no restrictions on the trading and use of Bitcoin, that is, the areas marked in green and orange.

TT3.text: Based on the above data, it is known that out of the 246 countries globally recorded, a total of 99 countries (or 40% of them) do not impose restrictions on the trading and use of Bitcoin, which are represented by the green and orange areas.

ST.en: Seven countries (or 3%) are restricted markets (pale pink), 10 countries (or 4%) have defined Bitcoin as illegal (dark pink), and 130 countries (or 53) %) haven't given comments on digital currency (grey).
ST.zh: 有7个国家（或占比3%）是受限市场（淡粉色），有10个国家（或占比4%）定义比特币为非法（深粉色），有130个国家（或占比53%）还没有更多的对待数字货币信息（灰色）。

TT1.text: There are 7 countries (or 3%) that are restricted markets (light pink), 10 countries (or 4%) that define Bitcoin as illegal (dark pink), and 130 countries (or 53%) that do not have additional information on the treatment of digital currencies (gray).

TT2.text: There are 7 countries (or 3%) that are restricted markets (light pink), 10 countries (or 4%) that define Bitcoin as illegal (dark pink), and 130 countries (or 53%) that do not have further information on the treatment of digital currencies (grey).

TT3.text: There are 7 countries (or 3%) that are restricted markets (light pink), 10 countries (or 4%) that define Bitcoin as illegal (dark pink), and 130 countries (or 53%) that don't have additional information on how they treat digital currencies (gray).

ST.en: This shows that countries that account for the global majority (53%, more than half) are still indecisive about the legitimacy of digital currencies represented by Bitcoin. This means that the “black swan risk” is still very large for Bitcoin, because some of these countries may ultimately make legislation that restrict the use of digital currencies.
ST.zh: 这说明，占全球主体（53%，超过半数）的国家仍在观望以比特币为首的数字货币在境内的合法性，也代表了比特币的“黑天鹅风险”依旧很大，因为其中一部分国家最终可能会作出限制数字货币的立法决定。

TT1.text: This indicates that the majority of countries globally (53%, more than half) are still observing the legality of digital currencies, led by Bitcoin, within their own borders. It also signifies that the "black swan risk" for Bitcoin remains significant, as some of these countries may ultimately decide to enact legislation restricting digital currencies.

TT2.text: This indicates that the majority of countries globally (53%, more than half) are still observing the legality of digital currencies, led by Bitcoin, within their jurisdictions. It also signifies that the "black swan risk" of Bitcoin remains substantial, as some of these countries might ultimately decide to enact restrictive legislation on digital currencies.

TT3.text: This indicates that the majority of countries around the world (53%, over half) are still observing the legality of digital currencies, led by Bitcoin, within their borders. It also represents that the "black swan risk" of Bitcoin remains significant, as some of these countries might eventually decide to impose regulatory restrictions on digital currencies.

ST.en: The article believes that global regulators have not fully understood the digital currency as a new type of currency. This may be the main reason why most countries have not chosen a stance.
ST.zh: 文章认为，全球监管机构对数字货币这个新兴类别还没有完全理解，可能是大部分国家还没有作出表态的主要原因。

TT1.text: The article believes that the reason most countries have not yet made a statement may be that global regulators do not fully understand this emerging category of digital currencies.

TT2.text: The article believes that the primary reason most countries have not yet made a statement might be that global regulators do not fully understand this emerging category of digital currencies.

TT3.text: The article suggests that the main reason most countries have yet to take a stance might be because global regulatory bodies do not yet fully understand this emerging category of digital currency.

ST.en: Although Bitcoin’s popularity has grown exponentially since last year, it does not necessarily mean that all countries are interested in it. It's probably that some countries are concerned that the local currency may be undermined by digital currencies or that digital currencies are used by criminal organizations.
ST.zh: 尽管比特币的“人气”自去年以来呈指数级增长，并不代表所有国家都感兴趣，可能有些国家担心当地法币因此受到威胁，或更担心数字货币被犯罪组织利用。

TT1.text: Although Bitcoin's "popularity" has grown exponentially since last year, it doesn't mean that all countries are interested. Some countries may be concerned that their local currencies will be threatened or more worried that digital currencies will be used by criminal organizations.

TT2.text: Even though the "popularity" of Bitcoin has grown exponentially since last year, it does not mean that all countries are interested. Some countries might be worried that their local currencies could be threatened as a result, or they might be more concerned about digital currencies being used by criminal organizations.

TT3.text: Although the "popularity" of Bitcoin has grown exponentially since last year, it does not mean that all countries are interested. Some countries may be worried that their local currencies could be threatened, or more concerned that digital currencies might be used by criminal organizations.

ST.en: Wallstreetcn has published an article summarizing the news related to regulation measures against Bitcoin across the world since last week, including: China starts to crackdown on online platforms and mobile APPs of over-the-counter exchanges; South Korea is still considering to close the digital currency exchanges; the European Union holds the view that Bitcoin has not yet been widely accepted and warns investors of the risk of “losing everything”.
ST.zh: 华尔街见闻曾撰文详细总结了上周以来针对比特币的国际监管新闻，包括中国开始打击场外类交易所的集中服务在线平台和移动App、韩国仍在考虑关闭数字货币交易所、欧盟认为比特币还没有被广泛接受并警告投资者“赔到血本无归”的风险等。

TT1.text: Wall Street Journal once wrote a detailed summary of the international regulatory news regarding Bitcoin over the past week, including China starting to crack down on centralized service online platforms and mobile apps of off-exchange trading, South Korea still considering closing digital currency exchanges, and the EU believes that Bitcoin has not been widely accepted and warns investors about the risk of "losing everything."

TT2.text: Wall Street Journal once published an article that detailed a summary of international regulatory news regarding Bitcoin since last week. This included China initiating a crackdown on online platforms and mobile apps offering centralized services for over-the-counter exchanges, South Korea still considering closing digital currency exchanges, and the European Union believing that Bitcoin has not yet been widely accepted and warning investors of the risk of "losing everything."

TT3.text: Wall Street Insights had previously written an article that detailed a summary of the international regulatory news regarding Bitcoin since last week. This included China's initiation of a crackdown on the centralized service online platforms and mobile apps of over-the-counter exchanges, South Korea still considering shutting down digital currency exchanges, and the European Union's view that Bitcoin has not yet been widely accepted and a warning to investors about the risk of "losing everything."

ST.en: Wallstreetcn Editor's selection: Reading News | 2018: Global Central Banks Are Ushering Digital Currency? One article points out that 2018 is destined to be the first year of digital currency for central banks across the world, viewing from the perspectives of supervision, acceptance/criticism and adoption.
ST.zh: 华尔街见闻主编精选《读要闻|2018：全球央妈开启数字货币元年？》曾提到，从监管、接受/批判、采纳的任一角度来看，2018年都将成为全球央行的数字货币元年。

TT1.text: The chief editor of Wall Street Journal Select mentioned in the article "Top News | 2018: The Start of the Year of Digital Currency for Global Central Banks?" that from any perspective of regulation, acceptance/criticism, or adoption, 2018 will become the year of digital currencies for global central banks.

TT2.text: The selection of "Reading News | 2018: The Year Central Banks Worldwide Begin Digital Currency?" by the chief editor of Wall Street Insights and Wisdom once mentioned that from any perspective—regulation, acceptance/criticism, or adoption—2018 would become the inaugural year of digital currency for central banks worldwide.

TT3.text: The chief editor of Wallstreetcn selected "Read the News | 2018: The Year of Digital Currencies by Global Central Banks?" and mentioned that, from any perspective of regulation, acceptance/criticism, or adoption, 2018 will become the year of digital currencies for global central banks.

ST.en: The act of questioning the legal status of Bitcoin by big countries such as Russia is actually meant to make way for the official issuance of digital currencies.
ST.zh: 俄罗斯等大国批评比特币合法性地位的做法，其实也是为了给官方发行数字货币让路。

TT1.text: The practice of major countries like Russia criticizing the legitimacy of Bitcoin is actually to pave the way for the issuance of official digital currencies.

TT2.text: The actions of major countries like Russia in criticizing the legality of Bitcoin are actually to make way for the official issuance of digital currencies.

TT3.text: The criticism by major countries like Russia of the legitimacy of Bitcoin is actually to pave the way for the issuance of official digital currencies.

ST.en: On January 8th, the Barcelona new aid Philippe Coutinho showed up for the first time in Camp Nou with his Barcelona shirt, the Xinhua News Agency reported in Madrid by reporter Xie Yuzhi.
ST.zh: 新华社马德里1月8日电（报道员谢宇智）巴塞罗那新援库蒂尼奥8日在诺坎普首次身披巴萨球衣亮相。

TT1.text: Xinhua News Agency, Madrid, January 8 (Reporter Xie Yuzhi) — Barcelona's new signing Coutinho made his debut at Camp Nou, wearing the Barcelona jersey for the first time on the 8th.

TT2.text: Madrid, January 8, Xinhua News Agency (reporter Xie Yuzhi) - Barcelona's new signing Coutinho made his debut at Camp Nou on the 8th wearing the Barca jersey for the first time.

TT3.text: Xinhua News Agency, Madrid, January 8 (Reporter Xie Yuzhi) – Barcelona's new signing Coutinho made his first appearance in a Barcelona jersey on the 8th at Camp Nou.

ST.en: Coutinho passed a physical examination of Barcelona early that morning and signed with Barcelona president Bartomeu a contract that will expire in the summer of 2023.
ST.zh: 库蒂尼奥当日上午通过了巴萨的体检，并与巴萨主席巴托梅乌在一份将于2023年夏天到期的合同上签了字。

TT1.text: Coutinho passed his medical examination with Barcelona that morning and signed a contract with Barcelona’s president Bartomeu, which will expire in the summer of 2023.

TT2.text: On the morning of that day, Coutinho passed the medical examination for Barcelona and signed a contract with Barcelona's president Bartomeu, set to expire in the summer of 2023.

TT3.text: Coutinho passed the medical examination with Barcelona in the morning and signed a contract with Barcelona's president Bartomeu that will expire in the summer of 2023.

ST.en: Then he appeared in the face of nearly 7,000 Camp Nou fans as a Barcelona player.
ST.zh: 随后他作为巴萨球员，在诺坎普近7000名球迷面前亮相。

TT1.text: Afterwards, he made his appearance as a Barcelona player in front of nearly 7,000 fans at Camp Nou.

TT2.text: Later, as a Barcelona player, he made his appearance in front of nearly 7,000 fans at Camp Nou.

TT3.text: Later, as a Barcelona player, he made an appearance in front of nearly 7,000 fans at Camp Nou.

ST.en: According to a Spanish media, Coutinho's transfer fee may amount to 160 million euros (1 euro≈ 1.77 Chinese yuan), being the highest paid player in the history of Barcelona and La Liga.
ST.zh: 据西班牙媒体透露，库蒂尼奥的转会费总额或达到1.6亿欧元（1欧元约合7.77元人民币），是巴萨俱乐部及西甲历史第一身价。

TT1.text: According to Spanish media, Coutinho's total transfer fee might reach 160 million euros (1 euro is approximately 7.77 yuan), making it the highest in the history of both FC Barcelona and La Liga.

TT2.text: According to Spanish media, Coutinho's transfer fee may total 160 million euros (1 euro is approximately 7.77 yuan), making it the highest transfer fee in the history of both FC Barcelona and La Liga.

TT3.text: According to Spanish media, Coutinho's total transfer fee could reach 160 million euros (1 euro is approximately 7.77 yuan), making it the highest in the history of Barcelona club and La Liga.

ST.en: As Coutinho is still injured at the moment, he still need recuperate for nearly 20 days before ushering in his debut in the Barcelona shirt.
ST.zh: 由于眼下库蒂尼奥仍有伤在身，他还需休整近20日才能迎来自己身披巴萨球衣的处子秀。

TT1.text: Due to Coutinho currently being injured, he will need nearly 20 days of rest before making his debut in a Barcelona jersey.

TT2.text: Since Coutinho is currently still injured, he will need nearly 20 more days of rest before making his debut in a Barcelona jersey.

TT3.text: Since Coutinho is still injured, he will need nearly 20 more days of recovery before he can make his debut in a Barcelona jersey.

ST.en: Is nothing sacred?
ST.zh: 还有什么神圣的东西？

TT1.text: What else is sacred?

TT2.text: What else is sacred?

TT3.text: What else is sacred?

ST.en: Now Trump's White House is targeting the Statue of Liberty
ST.zh: 现在特朗普的白宫正在瞄准自由女神像

TT1.text: The Trump White House is now targeting the Statue of Liberty.

TT2.text: The Trump White House is now targeting the Statue of Liberty.

TT3.text: The Trump White House is now targeting the Statue of Liberty.

ST.en: The surest mark of regime change is when they start attacking the statues.
ST.zh: 政权更迭最确定的标志是他们开始攻击雕像之时。

TT1.text: The most certain sign of a regime change is when they start attacking statues.

TT2.text: The most definite sign of a regime change is when they start attacking statues.

TT3.text: The most certain sign of a regime change is when they begin attacking statues.

ST.en: Americans appreciate this as well as anyone - hence the carefully stage-manged toppling of Saddam Hussein in Firdos square in Baghdad in 2003.
ST.zh: 美国人和任何人一样都赞同这一点。 因此，2003 年巴格达天堂广场的萨达姆?侯赛因被精心策划地推倒了。

TT1.text: Americans, like everyone else, agree on this point. Therefore, in 2003, Saddam Hussein was deliberately toppled in Baghdad's Paradise Square.

TT2.text: Americans, like everyone else, agree with this point. Therefore, in 2003, Saddam Hussein was meticulously toppled in Baghdad's Paradise Square.

TT3.text: Americans, like anyone else, agree with this point. Therefore, in 2003, Saddam Hussein was meticulously brought down in Baghdad's Paradise Square.

ST.en: Stephen Miller, one of the key ideologues of the Trump regime, surely knew what he was doing when he took a symbolic axe to the Statue of Liberty in a heated argument with CNN's Jim Acosta over the president's proposals to drastically limit legal immigration.
ST.zh: 斯蒂芬?米勒 (Stephen Miller) 作为特朗普政府的关键智囊之一，在与美国有线电视新闻网 (CNN) 的吉姆?阿科斯塔 (Jim Acosta) 就总统关于严格限制合法移民的提议进行激烈争论时,他肯定知道自己对自由女神像砍出象征性的一斧会发生什么事情。

TT1.text: As one of the key strategists in the Trump administration, Stephen Miller was certainly aware of the consequences when he and CNN’s Jim Acosta engaged in a heated debate over the president’s proposal to strictly limit legal immigration, making a symbolic strike at the Statue of Liberty.

TT2.text: Stephen Miller, as one of the key advisors in the Trump administration, certainly knew what would happen when he took a symbolic axe to the Statue of Liberty during a heated debate with CNN's Jim Acosta about the President's proposal to strictly limit legal immigration.

TT3.text: As one of the key strategists in the Trump administration, Stephen Miller certainly knew what would happen when he symbolically took an axe to the Statue of Liberty during a heated debate with CNN's Jim Acosta over the President's proposal to severely restrict legal immigration.

ST.en: In fairness, Miller did not attack the statue itself.
ST.zh: 公平地说，米勒并没有攻击雕像本身。

TT1.text: To be fair, Miller did not attack the statue itself.

TT2.text: To be fair, Miller did not attack the statue itself.

TT3.text: To be fair, Miller did not attack the statue itself.

ST.en: A horde of boat-trip owners and Liberty impersonators would have lynched him if he did.
ST.zh: 如果他这样做了，那么一群游船业主和自由主义的追随者一定会将他生吞活剥。

TT1.text: If he did this, then a group of boat owners and liberal followers would certainly tear him apart.

TT2.text: If he does this, then a group of boat owners and liberal followers will definitely tear him apart.

TT3.text: If he does that, a bunch of yacht owners and liberal followers will surely eat him alive.

ST.en: But he did attack its meaning, and in particular the meaning ascribed to it when Emma Lazarus's famous poem was added to its base in 1903, 17 years after the monument itself was completed.
ST.zh: 但是他确实攻击了塑像的意义，尤其是在 1903 年埃玛?拉撒路的着名诗歌被刻在基座上时（这座纪念碑在此后17年方建成）而具有的意义。

TT1.text: However, he did attack the significance of the statue, especially when Emma Lazarus's famous poem was inscribed on the pedestal in 1903 (the monument was completed 17 years later).

TT2.text: However, he did attack the significance of the statue, especially when Emma Lazarus's famous poem was inscribed on the pedestal in 1903 (the monument was built 17 years later).

TT3.text: However, he did indeed attack the significance of the statue, especially in 1903 when Emma Lazarus's famous poem was engraved on the pedestal (the monument was built 17 years later) and took on its meaning.

ST.en: As Miller scolded Acosta: "I don't want to get off into a whole thing about history here, but the Statue of Liberty is ... a symbol of American liberty lighting the world.
ST.zh: 正如米勒斥责阿科斯塔所说：“我不想在这里谈论历史的全部事实，但自由女神像是美国自由照亮世界的象征......。

TT1.text: As Miller rebuked Acosta, he said: "I don't want to get into all the historical facts here, but the Statue of Liberty is a symbol of American liberty illuminating the world..."

TT2.text: As Miller rebuked Acosta, "I don't want to get into the whole history here, but the Statue of Liberty is a symbol of America lighting the world with freedom..."

TT3.text: As Miller rebuked Acosta, "I don't want to get into a whole history debate here, but the Statue of Liberty is a symbol of American liberty lighting the world..."

ST.en: The poem that you're referring to, that was added later and is not part of the original Statue of Liberty."
ST.zh: 你所指的那首诗，那是后来又加上去的，不是原始自由女神像的一部分。”

TT1.text: "The poem you referred to was added later, it was not part of the original Statue of Liberty."

TT2.text: "The poem you are referring to was added later, it is not part of the original Statue of Liberty."

TT3.text: "The poem you are referring to was added later and is not part of the original Statue of Liberty."

ST.en: Miller is factually correct, but as he put it himself, this is not really about history.
ST.zh: 事实上，米勒是正确的，但是正如他自己所说的，这不是真正关于历史。

TT1.text: In fact, Miller is correct, but as he himself said, this is not really about history.

TT2.text: In fact, Miller is correct, but as he himself said, this is not really about history.

TT3.text: In fact, Miller is correct, but as he himself said, this is not really about history.

ST.en: It is about the contemporary resonance of Lazarus's startling words, the only ones in which a state has appeared to invite not just any old immigrants, but the poorest of the poor: "Your tired, your poor, / Your huddled masses yearning to breathe free, / The wretched refuse of your teeming shore."
ST.zh: 这涉及到拉撒路惊世之语的现代回音，唯一一个国家似乎不仅邀请任何老移民，而且还邀请穷人中最贫穷的人：“你的疲惫、你的穷困、或者你的挤作一团的民众渴望自由呼吸，/苦难的人拒绝你拥挤的海滩。”

TT1.text: This pertains to the modern echoes of Lazarus' world-shaking words, the only country that seems to not only invite any old immigrants but also the poorest of the poor: "Your tired, your poor, or your huddled masses yearning to breathe free, / The wretched refuse of your teeming shore."

TT2.text: This involves the modern echo of Lazarus's astounding words, the only country that seems to not only invite any old immigrants but also the poorest of the poor: "Your tired, your poor, your huddled masses yearning to breathe free, / The wretched refuse of your teeming shore."

TT3.text: This involves the modern echo of the astonishing words of Lazarus, the only nation that seems to not only invite any old immigrant but also invite the poorest of the poor: "Your tired, your poor, or your huddled masses yearning to breathe free, / The wretched refuse of your teeming shore."

ST.en: There has never been a time when the "wretched refuse" has been more visible on our screens.
ST.zh: 不存在“苦难的人拒绝”在我们的屏幕变得更刺眼的一刻。

TT1.text: There is no "rejection by the suffering person" at the moment our screens become more glaring.

TT2.text: "There is no 'refusal of suffering people' at the moment when our screens become more glaring."

TT3.text: "There is no such thing as 'the suffering people refuse' at the moment our screens become more glaring."

ST.en: Miller was not engaging in literary criticism - he was making it clear that these people are not welcome in Trump's USA.
ST.zh: 米勒并没有从事过文学评论工作，他清楚地表明，这些人在特朗普时代的美国不会受到欢迎。

TT1.text: Miller has not engaged in literary criticism, and he made it clear that these people would not be welcomed in Trump-era America.

TT2.text: Miller has never engaged in literary criticism, and he made it clear that these people would not be welcome in Trump's America.

TT3.text: Miller has never engaged in literary criticism; he clearly indicated that these people would not be welcomed in Trump's America.

ST.en: This conflict about the meaning of a statue is part of a wider political and cultural war: it is really a conflict about the meaning of America.
ST.zh: 这种关于雕像意义的冲突是更广泛的政治和文化战争的一部分：这实际上是与美国精神相冲突。

TT1.text: This kind of conflict over the meaning of statues is part of a broader political and cultural war: it is essentially at odds with the American spirit.

TT2.text: This kind of conflict over the meaning of statues is part of a broader political and cultural war: it is essentially in conflict with the American spirit.

TT3.text: This kind of conflict over the meaning of statues is part of a broader political and cultural war: it is actually in conflict with the American spirit.

ST.en: Lazarus - and her friends who campaigned to place her words at the base after her death - knew very well that they were engaging in a highly political act.
ST.zh: 拉扎鲁斯 (Lazarus) ，以及她的、在她去世后举行活动将她的诗句铭刻在基座上的朋友们，很清楚他们正在参与的行为具有高度政治性。

TT1.text: Lazarus, along with her friends, who engraved her verses on the pedestal after her death, were well aware that their actions were highly political.

TT2.text: Lazarus and her friends, who held events to inscribe her verses on the pedestal after her death, were well aware that their actions were highly political.

TT3.text: Lazarus, and her friends who held events to inscribe her verses on the pedestal after her death, were well aware that their actions were highly political.

ST.en: The sculpture was intended to mark the connections between French and American republicanism by representing in a well-worn classical trope, the female embodiment of Liberty.
ST.zh: 该雕塑的目的是通过作为自由女神的女性化身的、古老的经典比喻来表达法国和美国共和主义之间的联系。

TT1.text: The purpose of the sculpture is to express the connection between French and American republicanism through the ancient classical metaphor of a female figure embodying the Statue of Liberty.

TT2.text: The purpose of the sculpture is to express the connection between French and American republicanism through the ancient classical metaphor of a woman embodying the Statue of Liberty.

TT3.text: The purpose of the sculpture is to express the connection between French and American republicanism through the ancient classical metaphor of a woman personifying the Statue of Liberty.

ST.en: Lazarus changed that meaning: in her poem the female figure is no longer abstract - she has a voice.
ST.zh: 拉撒路改变了这个意思：在她的诗中，女性形象不再抽象,她要发声。

TT1.text: Lazarus changed this meaning: in her poems, the female image is no longer abstract, she wants to speak out.

TT2.text: Lazarus changed this meaning: In her poems, the female image is no longer abstract, she wants to have a voice.

TT3.text: Lazarus changed the meaning: in her poetry, the image of women is no longer abstract; she seeks to voice her thoughts.

ST.en: And she gives herself a very different name: Mother of Exiles.
ST.zh: 她给自己起了一个非常不同的名字：流放之母。

TT1.text: She gave herself a very different name: Mother of Exile.

TT2.text: She gave herself a very unique name: Mother of Exile.

TT3.text: She gave herself a very different name: Mother of Exile.

ST.en: The marrying of the poem to the image is a brilliant feminist coup and a devastating attack on American nativism.
ST.zh: 这首诗与这幅画的结合是一场成功的女权主义政变,并且是对美国本土主义的毁灭性打击。

TT1.text: The combination of this poem and this painting is a successful feminist coup and a devastating blow to American nativism.

TT2.text: The combination of this poem and this painting is a successful feminist coup and a devastating blow to American nativism.

TT3.text: The combination of this poem and this painting is a successful feminist coup and a devastating blow to American nativism.

ST.en: And just as Lazarus changed the meaning of the statue, rightwingers have long wanted to change it back.
ST.zh: 就像拉撒路改变雕像的意义一样，右翼者一直想要把它改回原意。

TT1.text: Just as Lazarus changed the meaning of the statue, the right-wingers have always wanted to revert it to its original meaning.

TT2.text: Just as Lazarus changed the meaning of the statue, the right-wingers have been trying to revert it to its original intent.

TT3.text: Just as Lazarus changed the meaning of the statue, the right-wingers have always wanted to restore it to its original meaning.
